qas.question: What consideration is more important for college teams than exhibition games?
What is a game called in which a team plays against itself?
Championships are decided by formulas for college teams below what level?
What kind of games exist between opposing colleges at the highest level?
What kind of polling is not important in college football?
What is a game called in which a team plays against another team?
How are championships decided at levels above football bowl subdivision?

context: <b3_0>True exhibition games<b3_0/> between opposing colleges at the highest level do not exist in college football; due to the importance of <a0_0><b4_0>opinion polling<b4_0/><a0_0/> in the top level of college football, even exhibition games would not truly be exhibitions because they could influence the opinions of those polled. <a1_0><b5_0>Intramural<a1_0/> games<b5_0/> are possible because a team playing against itself leaves little ability for poll participants to make judgments, and at levels below the <a2_0>Football Bowl Subdivision<a2_0/> (FBS), championships are decided by <b6_0>objective formulas<b6_0/> and thus those teams can play non-league games without affecting their playoff hopes.
